description:
$28.00 - $34.00 per hour.

Full-Time

The Production Planner is responsible for preparing work schedules, tracking progress, updating critical path schedules, and communicating changes. This role tracks production activity to help ensure a smooth and controlled flow of materials, troubleshoot potential scheduling problems, assist with providing solutions, identify material deficiencies and remove blockers to ensure on-time product delivery.

Essential Job Functions

  • Responsible for support and coordination in planning, and scheduling for daily, weekly, and monthly plant production material and material requirements.
  • Create and maintain daily, weekly, and monthly production schedule.
  • Generate daily, weekly, and monthly cases produced volume reports.
  • Addressing production issues and delays to minimize downtime.
  • Forecast production execution needs by coordinating raw material releases for production projections.
  • Communicate effectively and proactively with vendors to meet deliveries based on lead times.
  • Provide accurate information on material consumption for process orders, materials, quantities and lot numbers.
  • Initiates, updates, and confirmed daily production process order for work in progress and finished goods.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5-7 years of experience in procurement, logistics, supply chain or similar role.
  • Experience with inventory management and capacity planning.
  • Exceptional detail and organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects.
  • Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Knowledge of ERP/MRP systems.
  • Prefer advanced excel skills in creating spreadsheets, pivot tables and charts, formulas and functions, VLOOKUP and conditional formatting, etc.
  • Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of changing situations under stress.
  • Familiarity with manufacturing process and equipment.
  • Strong organizational and scheduling skills.
  • Ability to analyze data and create reports which accurately reflect the state of business.
  • Ability to troubleshoot production issues and implement corrective actions.

Preferred Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in supply chain, Engineering or related discipline.
  • 2 or more years of practical experience with ERP/MRP systems in a production environment.
  • Previous experience in supply chain/logistics with manufacturing.
